instructions: 1. Boil the potatoes for about 20 minutes or until they are soft.
2. Chop up the spring onion and lightly fry it for about 1 minute or before it darkens in colour.
3. Mash the potatoes and add them to a bowl.
4. Add the tuna, salt, pepper, corn starch and an egg yolk to the bowl and mix them together with the mashed potatoes until the ingredients hold.
5. Grab a handful (or a tablespoon measurement) of the mixture and form disc-shaped patties. Use some flour when forming them.
6. Add some oil to a pan over medium-high heat.
7. Once the pan is hot, add the patties and fry them until they are golden-brown. Try to flatten them as much as possible to allow them to cook in the centre.
8. Once they are fried, set them aside to cool off before serving. Serve with sauces and chips.
